greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = smallest k with sigma(k) + phi(k) - 2k = A278373(n).
link: David W. Wilson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
n = 24 is the smallest number with sigma(n) + phi(n) - 2n = 20 = A278383(18), so a(18) = 24.
mathematica: Function[w, Map[Position[w, #][[1, 1]] &, Take[#, 72]] &@ Union@ w]@ Table[DivisorSigma[1, n] + EulerPhi@ n - 2 n, {n, 10^4}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 30 2016 *)
results.author: _David W. Wilson_, Nov 19 2016
